item.title: China Says Electric Vehicle Talks With EU Reach Final Stages
item.description: China’s commerce ministry said talks with the European Union on setting minimum prices for Chinese-made electric vehicles have “entered final stages,” although more work is required to reach a deal.
item.dc:creator: John Liu, Lin Zhu

media:content.media:description: The launch event of the BYD Co. Dolphin Surf electric vehicle in Paris, France, on Wednesday, May 21, 2025. The launch of the Dolphin Surf, a fully-electric hatchback, will likely strengthen BYD’s foothold in Europe at a time when Chinese EV makers have been losing momentum on the continent.

item.title: Austria Cut to Record Low by Fitch as Budget Woes Persist
item.description: Austria’s sovereign credit was cut by Fitch Ratings to two steps below the top mark for the first time, handing the recently-formed government another setback in its bid to repair the country’s finances.
item.dc:creator: Marton Eder

media:content.media:description: Tourists and shoppers near the Sisi Museum in Vienna, Austria, on Thursday, Oct. 10, 2024. Austria's final consumer prices rose 1.8% year-over-year in September, according to Statistik Austria.

item.title: ECB’s Vujcic Says Interest-Rate Reductions Are Nearly Done
item.description: The European Central Bank’s interest-rate cutting campaign is almost over, Governing Council member Boris Vujcic said.
item.dc:creator: Mark Schroers

media:content.media:description: Boris Vujcic, governor of the Croatian National Bank, during a Bloomberg Television interview at the Ten Years Of Euro In Latvia conference in Riga, Latvia on Friday, Jan. 26, 2024. The conference brings policy makers, experts and civil society representatives who played a pivotal role in the introduction of the euro all across Europe and specifically in Latvia.

item.title: Vietnam Inks Deals to Buy $3 Billion US Products Before Talks
item.description: Vietnamese businesses have signed 20 agreements worth about $3 billion to import more US agricultural products ahead of the third round of official negotiations set to take place next week.
item.dc:creator: Giang Nguyen

media:content.media:description: A worker uses a tractor to plant soybeans at Double G Angus Farms in Tiffin, Iowa, US, on Tuesday, May 6, 2025. Soybean futures posted the biggest intraday gain in more than three weeks on Wednesday after the US and China confirmed trade talks, lifting market sentiment over demand for American crop supplies. Photographer: Benjamin Roberts/Bloomberg

item.title: A Major American Egg Farm Just Lost 90% of its Chickens
item.description: Are egg prices going up again?
item.dc:creator: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal

media:content.media:description: ISA Brown chickens in a chicken coop at an egg farm in Mason, Michigan, US, on Monday, March 3, 2025. Egg prices have soared to a record of over $8 a dozen, driven by the worst-ever outbreak of avian flu in the US and contributing to broader inflation pressures. Photographer: Emily Elconin/Bloomberg

item.title: A Major Egg Farm Just Lost 90% of its Chickens
item.description: Egg prices have come down a lot since their recent record and bird flu has largely faded from the headlines. But the epidemic is still raging and, per one farmer, risks becoming endemic in the US. Glenn Hickman is president of Hickman’s Egg Ranch in Arizona, one of the largest egg producers in the US. You might remember him from our series last year, Beak Capitalism, in which we explored some of the thorniest issues facing the US economy through the medium of chickens. Well, news from the Hickma
item.dc:creator: Joe Weisenthal, Tracy Alloway

item.title: China Central Bank Extends Gold-Buying Streak for Seventh Month
item.description: China’s central bank expanded its gold reserves for a seventh straight month in May, furthering its bid to diversify holdings despite ongoing price fluctuations.
item.dc:creator: Yihui Xie, Lin Zhu

item.title: Rio Tinto Eyes Bailout for Australian Aluminum Smelter, AFR Says
item.description: Rio Tinto Group is seeking a multibillion-dollar government bailout for its Tomago aluminum smelter — Australia’s largest electricity user — due to spiraling energy costs, the Australian Financial Review reported.
item.dc:creator: Jason Scott

media:content.media:description: The Tomago Aluminium smelter in New South Wales. Google Maps

item.title: Taiwan Official Discusses US Energy Cooperation at Alaska Summit
item.description: Taiwan’s top presidential aide discussed energy cooperation with US officials at a summit this week in Alaska, where a liquefied natural gas project has come into focus for potential exporting to the island.
item.dc:creator: Denise Wee, Cindy Wang

media:content.media:description: Storage sphere tanks for liquefied natural gas. Photographer: Annie Sakkab/Bloomberg

item.title: Stocks Hit Highest Since February on Jobs Surprise | The Close 6/06/2025
item.description: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Katie Nixon, Northern Trust, Betsey Stevenson, University of Michigan, Dan Dolev, Mizuho, Rashad Bilal & Troy Millings, Earn Your Leisure, Matthew Griffin, Bloomberg News, Barry Bannister, Stifel, Jess Menton, Bloomberg News, Ed Ludlow, Bloomberg News, Stacy Rasgon, Bernstein Research, Frances Katzen, Douglas Elliman, Brett Winton, Ark Invest, Tony Zaccario, Stretch Zone, Nicole Camarre, 43North. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Best of the Qatar Economic Forum, Powered by Bloomberg
item.description: The Best of the Qatar Economic Forum, Powered by Bloomberg - bringing together some of the world's most influential thinkers, policy makers and business leaders to discuss how the global economy is transforming amid the changing geopolitical landscape, as Gulf nations emerge as key centers of financial power and opportunity. This special Bloomberg program highlights biggest interviews and news makers from the fifth edition of the annual forum that took place on May 20, 2025 in Doha. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: US-China Future, Cheap Gas, UK Losing Millionaires, Investing in Big Law | Wall Street Week
item.description: This week, former Treasury Secretary Lawrence H. Summers and Hoover Institution’s Niall Ferguson debate US and China's "hostile codependence." And, as President Trump touts lower gasoline prices, some experts explain why it’s concerning. Plus, more millionaires in the UK are packing their bags for Italy, but will it be for good? Later, how will private equity change Big Law? (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Peloton CEO Says He Has No Interest in Selling the Company
item.description: Peloton CEO Peter Stern joins Bloomberg's Mark Gurman at the Bloomberg Tech Summit to talk the company's growth goals, its use of AI, and why he is not interested in selling. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: S&P Dow Jones Leaves S&P 500 Unchanged in Rebalance
item.description: S&P Dow Jones Indices left membership in the S&P 500 unchanged in its latest round of quarterly rebalancing on Friday, according to a company spokesperson.
item.dc:creator: Emily Graffeo

media:content.media:description: Traders work on the floor at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Monday, May 19, 2025. A renewed wave of dip buying fueled a rebound in stocks from session lows, with traders trying to look past the US downgrade by Moody’s Ratings that has sent bond yields climbing and weakened the US dollar. Photographer: Michael Nagle/Bloomberg

item.title: Finance Chief Signals That Colombia Will Suspend Fiscal Rule
item.description: Colombian Finance Minister German Avila signaled that the nation will suspend its fiscal anchor and also called for substantial interest rate cuts.
item.dc:creator: Andreina Itriago, Matthew Bristow

item.title: Earn Your Leisure CEOs Unveil the Invest Fest Lineup
item.description: INTV - Rishad Bilal & Troy Millings - Earn Your Leisure, Co-CEOs & Co-Founders speak with Alix Steel and Romaine Bostick about Invest Fest 2025 and navigating today's market. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: UMichigan Economist on "B+" Jobs Report
item.description: Betsey Stevenson, University of Michigan, Professor of Economics and Public Policy speaks with Alix Steel and Romaine Bostick about the US jobs report. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump Crypto-Wallet Spat Ends With World Liberty Buying Memecoin
item.description: Eric Trump signaled that the tension between the competing factions of Donald Trump’s crypto empire has cooled and the family’s World Liberty Financial will buy a “substantial’ amount of the memecoin at the center of the dispute.
item.dc:creator: Dave Liedtka

media:content.media:description: Eric Trump, executive vice president of Trump Organization Inc., during the Bitcoin 2025 conference in Las Vegas, Nevada, US, on Wednesday, May 28, 2025. The event will examine Bitcoin's evolving global impact, with speakers from education, policy, finance, and technology.

item.title: Ark Chief Futurist on Musk-Trump Rift’s Impact on Tesla
item.description: Ark Invest Chief Futurist Brett Winton discusses the outlook for Tesla amid the current rift between President Donald Trump and Elon Musk. He speaks on “Bloomberg The Close.”

item.title: Trump Discouraging International Students From Studying in US: Feldblum
item.description: Harvard University won a temporary reprieve from President Donald Trump’s ban on its international students entering the US, a legal setback for the administration in its high-profile fight with the school. Presidents' Alliance on Higher Ed and Immigration President Miriam Feldblum has more on the story. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Tesla Shares Caught in the Middle of Musk-Trump Breakup
item.description: When President Donald Trump won the election in November, investors viewed Tesla Inc. as one of the biggest winners. That bet now seems to be on shaky ground after investors watched the once formidable alliance dissolve in real time.
item.dc:creator: Joel Leon

media:content.media:description: Tesla vehicles at the company's store in Colma, California.

item.title: Yield Rise After Strong Jobs Report | Real Yield 6/6/2025
item.description: Sonali Basak highlights the market-moving news you need to know. Today's guests: JPMorgan Asset Management Global FICC US CIO Kay Herr, Invesco Head of Fixed Income Business Strategy and Development Stephanie Larosiliere, HSBC Americas Head of Debt Capital Markets Patrice Altongy, and Barings High Yield Portfolio Manager Michael Best. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Musk-Trump Breakup Exposes Cracks in Wall Street’s Meme Casino
item.description: It took less than a day for the great Donald Trump-Elon Musk split to reshape debates over billionaire power and influence in American capitalism.
item.dc:creator: Denitsa Tsekova, Alexandra Semenova

media:content.media:description: WASHINGTON, DC - MARCH 11: (Editor's Note: Alternative Crop) U.S. President Donald Trump, accompanied by White House Senior Advisor, Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk, walks past a Tesla Model S on the South Lawn of the White House on March 11, 2025 in Washington, DC. Trump spoke out against calls for a boycott of Elon Musk's companies and said he would purchase a Tesla vehicle in what he calls a 'show of confidence and support' for Elon Musk. (Photo by Andrew Harnik/Getty Images)

item.title: Fans Line Up for Nintendo Switch 2
item.description: Bloomberg’s Cecilia D'Anastasio explains what is behind the excitement for Nintendo’s Switch 2. She joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Technology.” (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Top Parkland Holder Backs Sunoco Deal, Urges Others to Follow
item.description: The top shareholder in Parkland Corp. said it supports the Canadian fuel distributor’s proposed takeover by Sunoco LP, describing the deal as a turning point for the company.
item.dc:creator: Paula Sambo

media:content.media:description: Oil storage tanks at the Sunoco Terminal in Crockett, California,.

item.title: Stablecoin Firm Circle Surge From IPO Hits 247% on Day Two
item.description: Circle Internet Group’s shares continued to soar on Friday, sending the stock 247% above the IPO price in the stablecoin issuer’s second day as a public company.
item.dc:creator: Monique Mulima

media:content.media:description: Circle Internet Financial signage during the company's initial public offering on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange, on June 5.

item.title: Stocks Hit Highest Since February on Jobs Surprise: Markets Wrap
item.description: Stocks closed at their highest since February and bond yields rose as jobs data allayed concerns of an imminent economic slowdown. Equities also gained amid hopes US-China trade tensions are easing, with President Donald Trump saying negotiators will talk Monday.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth, Andre Janse Van Vuuren

item.title: Revelation-Backed Omada Health Jumps After $150 Million IPO
item.description: Omada Health Inc. shares ended their debut trading day exactly where they started after the digital health-care company raised $150 million in its initial public offering.
item.dc:creator: Angel Adegbesan, Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: A Wall Street sign near the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Thursday, May 22, 2025. A surge in long-term bond yields is once again threatening to upend a crowded hedge-fund bet that Treasuries will perform better than interest-rate swaps. Photographer: Michael Nagle/Bloomberg

item.title: Banks Launch $1.5 Billion Loan for Silver Lake’s Altera Stake
item.description: A group of banks led by Barclays Plc launched a $1.5 billion loan sale to support Silver Lake Management’s acquisition of a majority stake in programmable chips unit Altera Corp. from Intel Corp., according to a person with knowledge of the matter.
item.dc:creator: Rene Ismail, Jeannine Amodeo

media:content.media:description: Signage outside Altera Corp. headquarters in San Jose, California, US, on Friday, Sept. 6, 2024. Intel is reportedly planning to sell Altera, its programmable chip unit, as a result of the company's mounting financial struggles, with Marvell Technology seen as a likely buyer, according to media reports.

item.title: Traders Reel In Fed Cut Bets as Strong Job Data Drags on Bonds
item.description: Treasuries slumped after stronger-than-expected US job and wage growth prompted traders to trim bets that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates this year.
item.dc:creator: Ye Xie, Michael Mackenzie

media:content.media:description: The US Treasury building in Washington, DC.
